headline: 1 Growth Stock Down 20% to Buy Right Now
summary: This is because these companies rely on a solid economic environment to expand their businesses and lift earnings -- and these days, investors are uncertain about what lies ahead.  Investors earlier in the year hoped for an improving economy and ongoing interest rate cuts, but President Donald Trump's announcement of tariffs on imports threatened such a scenario.  Let's check out one growth stock down 20% so far this year that should be on your buy list.

headline: 2 No-Brainer Warren Buffett Stocks to Buy Right Now
summary: With market volatility on the rise, a great place to look for solid investments is Berkshire Hathaway's stock portfolio.  Warren Buffett's ability to identify durable companies that can weather economic cycles has created tremendous wealth for Berkshire shareholders.  Here are two elite growth stocks from its $271 billion stock portfolio that are no-brainer buys right now.

headline: Amazon Stock Sell-Off: Should You Buy the Dip?
summary: Amazon has been caught in the recent market sell-off, with the e-commerce behemoth's shares down nearly 30% off its highs as of this writing.  Amazon's stock is not only off its highs, it is also trading at one of the cheapest valuations in its history.  To put that in perspective, over the past 10 years, Amazon has had an average trailing P/E of 137, and its three-year average is nearly 84.

headline: MercadoLibre Stock Will Likely Stand Out Amid Tariff Pressures. Here's Why.
summary: Investing in U.S. stocks brings near-term uncertainty.  The ever-changing tariff levels mean that U.S. consumers and businesses are unsure of what many items and inputs will cost, making the business environment difficult to navigate.  Such conditions increase the appeal of international stocks not tied to the U.S., and this could play into the hands of MercadoLibre (NASDAQ: MELI).

headline: If I Could Buy Only 1 Warren Buffett Stock Amid the Stock Market Chaos, This Would Be It
summary: Looking at the stocks Warren Buffett owns is a great place to start.  Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE: BRK.A) (NYSE: BRK.B) portfolio includes several worthy contenders.  Coca-Cola (NYSE: KO) is a better pick for risk-averse investors.
